answers.answer: Its ok about the house. dont worry about it. It will be there when youa re ready to tackle it.(LOL) Its almost spring and you can haul it out and start over. besides what is housekeeping? It is moving dirt fgrom one spot to another and more will come back.seriously are you doing ok with your thryoid and stuff? when was the last time you had your labs done. I think it was not too long ago but it wouldnt hurt to get them checked again. and what about the diabetes thing? you arent are you?Just borderline right? My hubby has been borderline for 5 years lol  He is doing ok I been making him eat healthy choice meals for lunch and we are both loosing weight.any way I hope you feel better soon my sister.Love VenoraPS I could use a good bit of manic my self. My house was alwasy so clean when I was manic haha.  VM

My house is sooooooooo bad.  LOL  It's just driving me crazy right now b/c I'm stuck in it so much cause there's nothing to do outside.  I'll get over come really pretty weather when I can get outdoors and enjoy.  Really getting a bad case of the winter blahs.  Anything would be better than looking at this grey and brown baroness!  It wears on me.  I also want to be able to open windows and enjoy the fresh air.  Come on spring!You must not have read my post on the thyroid forum.  My TSH was at 1.32 and of course they said it's "within normal range"!!!!!  But I fired my endo and my PCP has upped my levo b/c I told him I had all the hypo symptoms again.  Really tired, but also losing hair, night sweats, days and nights reversed, and you know the drill.  He really listened and is willing to keep me down where I feel good.  So happy about that.  :)I have Type 2 diabetes.  Think a lot of it is my weight.  Am hoping anyway.  Have lost 10 lbs. since the Jan 19.  Yeah for me!!  I have a ton still to go, but it's coming off and I'm controlling my diabetes very well.  Diabetes really runs in my family, but am hoping this will take care of mine.  Feel better since I've got it under control.  If your hubby continues to keep his numbers down he may not EVER go diabetic.  That would be so great!Everything got done when I was manic.  Was also so creative.  Now, forget it.  Think the hardest thing to give up when being treated for bipolar is the mania.  Think that's the reason people quit taking their meds most of the time.  Makes a huge difference in who you are as opposed to who you used to be.  Did that make sense?Have they got your thyroid back where it needs to be?  Last I knew you were having to adjust meds.  Glad to hear you are doing so well otherwise.  Congratulations on the weight loss.  It is SO hard, especially with not having a thyroid, it seems.Dac

question: If anyone out there currently in a manic phase is tired of it could you please address it to "Dead Tired in Oklahoma" and send it on it's way.  I know it will find me.  My house is so bad I think if I don't get a lot of energy really soon am going to have to bulldoze it and start from scratch.  ZzzzzzzzzzzzzDac(shhh  be very quiet she's sleeping again)
title: Wanted:  Short-Term Manic Phase
